subtitles.dialogue_text: Dad, do you want some candy?
Out of the way. l can't open the screens.
Maybe there are squirrels in here.
Or rats; they like acorns too.
Here, l'll get the door for you. Satsuki, open up the kitchen.
Dunno. A bunch of black things but not roaches or mice.
That's right. Ghosts don't come out on days like this.
When you walk into a dark room from outside,
your eyes dim and so the dustbunnies come out.
Come here, dustbunnies. Come out, come out, wherever you are!
Let's get to work! See if you can find how to get upstairs.
Get up there and open all the windows.
That's exciting! l've always wanted to live in a haunted house.
This is "Nanny". She's come to look after the house.
l'm Satsuki and this is my sister, Mei.
l'd have cleaned up if l'd known you'd be this quick.
Lately l've been so busy in the rice paddies. l only did a bit of dusting...
What have you done to your hands?
Those little, black, fuzzy things that fly?
That's right. They breed in empty old houses,
and cover them with soot and dust.
l could see them when l was little. Now you can too, huh?
Are they like goblins or something?
lf you keep smiling, they'll soon leave the house.
They're probably deciding where to go next, right now.
What happens if a huge one comes out, like this?
Okay then, l won't walk you to the bathroom at night.
Okay, cleaning time. Could you get some water from the stream?
Good, keep pumping 'til the water gets cold.
You live in a haunted house!
l did the same kind of thing when l was his age.
But l really love Nanny's rice cakes!
Eat as much as you want.
Thank you very much for your help.
Dad, the house is going to fall down.
l hope not; we've only just moved in.
Come on, let's laugh to keep the bogeymen away!
l mean it. l'm not scared!
Come on, keep up the good work...
To visit Mommy in the hospital!
So glad you came, my dear.
Daddy is talking to the doctor.
lt's so good to see you all.
Have you settled into the new house?
Of course l do! l can't wait to see them.
Mei was worried that you wouldn't like ghosts.
Are you fixing Mei's hair, Satsuki?
lt's really good. Lucky girl, Mei.
But she always gets mad at me.
No, l like it like this.
Wavy hair, just like mine when l was your age.
Will it be like yours when l grow up?
Probably. You take after your Mom.
You're right. The doctor says she'll be home soon.
Tomorrow is a little too soon.
Mom said she'll sleep with me in my bed.
Weren't you saying you're big enough to sleep alone?
l've got to bring a box lunch today.
lt's all right. l've made something for all of us.
Do l look all grown up?
Yes dear. And where might you be going?
You be the flower shop, Daddy.
Who are you? A big Dustbunny?
Hey there. ls it that late already?
Where's Mei? l'm off to Michiko's.
We haven't eaten yet. ls Mei in the garden?
You mean that troll in your picture book?
Yeah. He was all hairy with a big mouth like this.
There's a tiny one and a little one and a huge one like this.
This is a great hiding place.
Dad, Mei said she saw a Totoro here.
lt went to a big tree.
But there wasn't any other path.
But it's true! Totoro was here. l'm not lying.
Neither of us think you're lying.
You probably met the king of this forest You were very lucky.
He doesn't come out very often.
We should go to the shrine to pay our respects.
Are you sure it was here?
l told you he doesn't come to see us often.
But will he come again? l want to meet him, too.
This tree must have stood here for years and years.
Trees and people used to be good friends.
l saw that tree and decided to buy the house. Hope Mom likes it too.
Okay, let's pay our respects then get home for lunch.
Oh yeah, l promised to go see Michiko!
Thank you for looking after Mei.
Last one home's a rotten egg!
Dear Mother, something amazing happened today.
And l'm hoping to see him myself soon, too.
Kanta, hurry up! You'll be late!
l'm sorry. She insisted that she be with you.
lt's Dad's day at the university.
You promised to be a good girl at Nanny's.
l still have two more classes and Nanny's too busy for this...
She was good up'til now, weren't you?
l'll go talk to my teacher.
Since Satsuki's mother's in the hospital l want you all to be nice to her.
l can't stay after class today.
Hurry up, it's going to rain!
l won't cry. Aren't l good?
Dear Guardian Spirit, let us stay until the rain stops.
What idiot forgets his umbrella on a rainy day?
You broke it playing, l bet.
Not at all. Sorry we couldn't do more.
He did? A broken old thing like that!
Mei was with me, so l was glad.
But l'm so sorry that Kanta got wet.
Not at all. lt probably cleaned him up a little.
Are you off to meet your father?
He'll be on the next one. Why don't you wait at Nanny's?
l told you. Wanna go to Nanny's?
lt won't be much longer. Hang in there.
The train was late and l missed the bus.
We met him, Dad! He was here!
We met him! We met Totoro!
Dear Mother, l can't tell you how excited l was today.
lt was the scariest, funniest day l've ever had.
Totoro gave us a lovely present...
...wrapped in bamboo leaves and tied with dragon whiskers.
When we opened it, it was full of magic nuts and seeds!
We decided to plant them in the garden to make a lovely forest.
But they haven't sprouted yet. Mei sits there all day, waiting for them.
She looks like a little crab.
Dearest, dear Mom, get well soon. Love, Satsuki.
Daddy, do you think they will come out tomorrow?
Well, l'm sure Totoro would know. Night night.
That's where we planted the seeds.
The sun blessed these so they're really good for you.
Would they help my Mom, too?
Of course. lf she eats my vegetables, she'll get better right away.
She's supposed to be back next Saturday.
But it's only for a couple of days. To get used to the new house.
l see. We'll feed her lots of vegetables then.
l'll give her this corn l picked.
l'm sure she'll be very pleased.
There was a telegram for you.
Dad won't be back till late, what shall l do?
Open it, it might be important.
lt's from Mom's hospital! Something's happened to her!
Calm down. Do you know where your Dad is?
l know his office number, but we don't have a telephone.
Kanta, take her to used the phone in the main house!
Hello, l'd like to make a long-distance call, please.
Hello, may l speak to Dad... er... Mr. Kusakabe?
Hello, what's up? From the hospital?
Okay, l'll call them right away.
ls there anything wrong with Mom?
Don't worry. l'll check up and call you right back.
l'm hanging up now, stay there.
May l stay here until he calls back?
Stay as long as you like.
No, this corn is for my Mommy!
Listen Mei. Mom's not well so she's not coming home this time.
You don't want her to get worse, do you?
lt's just for a few more days.
So you don't care if she dies, do you?
We should bring the washing in...
Don't worry too much, Satsuki. Nanny's here to help, so cheer up.
Your Dad said he'll stop by the hospital to check on her.
Besides, it's just a cold; she'll be back next week.
They said it was just a cold...
Stop it. Nobody would leave two pretty little girls like you.
l'll be here until Daddy comes back, okay?
Wasn't she at the bus stop?
That's strange. Where has she gone?
l was nasty to her, 'cause she was being silly...
Maybe she's heading for the hospital!
The hospital? lt would take a grown-up three hours!
Kanta, hurry! Tell your dad that Mei is missing!
Have you seen a little girl pass by? She's my sister.
Are you sure she came this way?
l'm looking for my sister. Have you seen a little girl?
She's four. l think she's heading to the hospital.
No. We just came from there... but we didn't see anyone.
Dad and the others are looking for her. l'll go to the hospital,
l guess she got lost on the way to the hospital.
They found a sandal by the pond.
We're not sure if it's hers or not!
Dear Lord, please protect her and...
lt's too deep here, better search further away!
Hey, are there any poles left?
Thank heavens, l was sure it was hers.
Hey, Nanny was jumping to conclusions.
We better hurry, it'll be dark soon.
l really appreciate your help, everyone.
Don't worry, could have been any of us.
Maybe someone should call the police...
Mei is lost. lt'll be dark soon. l'm sure she's scared somewhere...
Mei is lost and we can't find her!
She must be scared, please help me find her!
l don't know what to do...
The trees are moving out of the way!
You wanted to take the corn to Mom?
Will you take us to the hospital?
l'm sorry. They didn't need to send a telegram just for a cold.
The girls must be worried. l'm sorry to upset them.
They'll be fine. As long as you're okay.
We've all learned to cope. This'll just postpone the enjoyment.
They've put up with it so well.
l'm especially sorry for Satsuki, she's so sensitive.
l'm going to spoil them for a while when l come home.
l can't wait to get back on my feet.
l could swear l just saw Satsuki and Mei laughing up in that tree.
